page.title: 04KING'S HEDGES SCHOOL
page.content: {KING'S HEDGES SCHOOL:}TWENTY YEARS AFTER THE SECOND WORLD WAR,THE EDUCATION AUTHORITY DECIDED THAT WE NEEDED MORE SCHOOLS IN CAMBRIDGE. THEY BUILT KINGS'S HEDGES INFANT & JUNIOR SCHOOLS ALONG WITH OTHERS.IN 1970 THERE WERE 12 TEACHERS INCLUDING A HEADMASTER AND DEPUTY.NOW THERE ARE EIGHT TEACHERS AND 152 CHILDREN COMPARED WITH 1970 WHEN THERE WERE NEARLY 300 PUPILS. DESPITE EXPENDITURE OF NEARLY Â£83,000. TO REPAIR STRUCTURAL DEFECTS.THE SCHOOL HAS NEVER BEEN FULLY WATERPROOF.THE PLAYGROUND HAS AN AREA OF 2,500Msq. WITH CLIMBING FRAME,HOPSCOTCH AND OTHER GAMES.FOOTBALL SEEMS TO BE THE MOST POPULAR GAME AND OFTEN CAUSES HEADACHES FOR THE TEACHERS ON PLAYGROUND DUTY.
